content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a continuous function such that <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 17, of, f of x, d x, equals 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></math>, <math alttext="the integral from, 17 to 20, of, f of x, d x, equals negative 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></math>, and <math alttext="the integral from, 13 to 20, of, f of x, d x, equals 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 13, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>?

topic.text: 1.14: Connecting Infinite Limits and Vertical Asymptotes

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
